1.q_string:
A student is provided with a variable voltage source \(V\), a test resistor \(R_T=10 \Omega\), two identical galvanometers \(G_1\) and \(G_2\) and two additional resistors, \(R_1=10 M \Omega\) and \(R_2=0.001 \Omega\). For conducting an experiment to verify ohm's law, the most suitable circuit is:

[2023 (06 Apr Shift 2)]

Figure shows a part of an electric circuit. The potentials at points \(a, b\) and \(c\) are \(30 \mathrm{~V}, 12 \mathrm{~V}\) and \(2 \mathrm{~V}\) respectively. The current through the \(20 \Omega\) resistor will be,


[2023 (06 Apr Shift 2)]

As shown in the figure the voltmeter reads \(2 \mathrm{~V}\) across \(5 \Omega\) resistor. The resistance of the voltmeter is \(\Omega\)


[2023 (06 Apr Shift 2)]

In this figure the resistance of the coil of galvanometer \(\mathrm{G}\) is \(2 \Omega\). The emf of the cell is \(4 \mathrm{~V}\). The ratio of potential difference across \(\mathrm{C}_1\) and \(\mathrm{C}_2\) is


[2023 (08 Apr Shift 1)]

A hollow cylindrical conductor has length of 3.14 \(m\), while its inner and outer diameters are \(4 mm\) and \(8 mm\) respectively. The resistance of the conductor is \(n \times 10^{-3} \Omega\).

If the resistivity of the material is \(2.4 \times 10^{-8} \Omega m\). The value of \(n\) is___________.

[2023 (24 Jan Shift 1)]

In a potentiometer arrangement, a cell gives a balancing point at \(75 cm\) length of wire. This cell is now replaced by another cell of unknown emf. If the ratio of the emf's of two cells respectively is \(3: 2\), the difference in the balancing length of the potentiometer wire in above two cases will be ________\(cm\).

[2022 (24 Jun Shift 1)]

A resistor develops \(300 J\) of thermal energy in \(15 s\), when a current of \(2 A\) is passed through it. If the current increases to \(3 A\), the energy developed in \(10 s\) is _____________J.

[2022 (25 Jun Shift 1)]

The length of a given cylindrical wire is increased to double of its original length. The percentage increase in the resistance of the wire will be _____________\(\%\).

[2022 (25 Jun Shift 2)]

An aluminium wire is stretched to make its length, \(04 \%\) larger. Then percentage change in resistance is:

[2022 (26 Jun Shift 1)]

A \(72 \Omega\) galvanometer is shunted by a resistance of \(8 \Omega\). The percentage of the total current which passes through the galvanometer is :

[2022 (27 Jun Shift 1)]

A cell, shunted by a \(8 \Omega\) resistance, is balanced across a potentiometer wire of length \(3 m\). The balancing length is \(2 m\) when the cell is shunted by \(4 \Omega\) resistance. The value of internal resistance of the cell will be _________\(\Omega\).

[2022 (27 Jun Shift 1)]

A square shaped wire with resistance of each side \(3 \Omega\) is bent to form a complete circle. The resistance between two diametrically opposite points of the circle in unit of \(\Omega\) will be:

[31 Aug 2021 Shift 1]

First, a set of \(n\) equal resistors of \(10 \Omega\) each are connected in series to a battery of emf \(20 V\) and internal resistance \(10 \Omega\). A current / is observed to flow. Then, the \(n\) resistors are connected in parallel to the same battery. It is observedthat the current is increased 20 times, then the value of \(n\) is________________.

[27 Aug 2021 Shift 1]

The resistance of a conductor at \(15^{\circ} C\) is \(16 \Omega\) and at \(100^{\circ} C\) is \(20 \Omega\). What will be the temperature coefficient of resistance of the conductor?

[27 Jul 2021 Shift 2]

In Bohr's atomic model, the electron is assumed to revolve in a circular orbit of radius \(0.5 \mathring{A}\). If the speed of electron is \(2.2 \times 16^6 m / s\), then the current associated with the electron will be _______________\(\times 10^{-2} mA\). [ Take \(\pi\) as \(\frac{22}{7}\) ]

[27 Jul 2021 Shift 1]

A current of \(5 A\) is passing through a non-linear magnesium wire of cross-section \(0.04 m ^2\). At every point the direction of current density is at an angle of \(60^{\circ}\) with the unit vector of area of cross-section.

The magnitude of electric field at every point of the conductor is:

(Resistivity of magnesium \(\rho=44 \times 10^{-8} \Omega m\) )

[20 Jul 2021 Shift 1]

q_option: ammeter is always used in parallel and voltmeter is series
Both ammeter and voltmeter must be connected in parallel
ammeter is always connected in series and voltmeter in parallel
Both, ammeter and voltmeter must be connected inseries

[27-Jan-2024 Shift 1]

[27-Jan-2024 Shift 2]

The electric current through a wire varies with time as \(\mathrm{I}=\mathrm{I}_0+\beta \mathrm{t}\). where \(I_0=20 \mathrm{~A}\) and \(\beta=3 \mathrm{~A} / \mathrm{s}\). The amount of electric charge crossed through a section of the wire in \(20 \mathrm{~s}\) is :
